intro: Drymophloeus zippellii, commonly known as the Zippellii ironwood, is a unique tropical tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and distinctive foliage. The plant exhibits a shrub-like growth habit with compound leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dry, rocky soils. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
